intro: Campanula porosa, commonly known as the airy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Campanula porosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
